intro: Microlicia sickii, commonly known as the sick's microlicia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
